column4: you mean like auto install like this? https://help.ubuntu.com/8.04/installation-guide/powerpc/automatic-install.html

I deleted partitions to install ubuntu, and want to install Win XP (Setup did not find any hard disk drives installed in your computer) and it needs to do Windows XP just do not know what program is for Windows nLite. and on ubuntu?

if you want to install windows also as dual boot you should install that first, then install ubuntu,  make sure before you install unbuntu the you leave an UNUSED partition that ubuntu will see and identify as where you want to install it.
use partition magic or use the ubuntu live boot cd and run gparted to resize the partitions to provide the needed space of at least 12 Gb for a ubuntu install
